intro_text: While on patrol, r_c notices an unfamiliar scent. Something here smells like a cat not from c_n.

success_text.unscathed_common: The scent leads to a trespassing rogue. Weird. r_c runs down the scree slope to see what's up with them, but the rogue turns and flees c_n territory.
success_text.unscathed_rare: r_c soon realizes that there are pawprints smelling of fox cubs. One must have wandered through this section of the border recently, but it's not a threat.
success_text.stat_skill: The scent leads to a trespassing rogue. s_c throws {PRONOUN/s_c/self} at the rogue, leaping from the rocky outcrops above, and quickly overwhelms the lone cat. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/accept/accepts} the rogue's surrender graciously, and escort them out of c_n territory promptly.
success_text.stat_trait: Boldy, s_c follows the scent to a trespassing rogue and confronts them, pointing out the clearly marked border which the rogue has crossed. From {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} seat above the rogue, perched on a high rock, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/listen/listens} to the rogue stutter out an explanation and a quick apology, unimpressed and confident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own strength.

fail_text.unscathed_common: It turns out they were r_c's own pawprints... r_c huffs with embarrassment, suddenly grateful {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} alone.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: The pawprints lead to a trespassing rogue. s_c tries to set up a trap by starting a rockslide, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/aren't/isn't} as smart as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/think/thinks} {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/are/is}. The trap fails, and the rogue wanders on.
fail_text.death: Nose to the ground following the trail, r_c doesn't see the blow that kills {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.
fail_text.injury: Nose to the ground following the trail, r_c doesn't see the blow coming. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/haul/hauls} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} feet, spitting with outrage, but the rogue that did it has already turned and run.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by an invading rogue.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by an invading rogue.

The rogue manages to escape {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} grasp and run off further into c_n territory.

intro_text: While on patrol, app1 notices an unfamiliar scent. Something here smells like a cat not from c_n.

success_text.unscathed_common: The scent leads to a trespassing rogue. Weird. app1 runs down the scree slope to see what's up with them, but the rogue turns and flees c_n territory. Well they couldn't have been super friendly then, app1 assumes.
success_text.unscathed_rare: app1 soon realizes that underneath the strange scent, there are pawprints that smell of c_n. Someone must have wandered through this section of the border recently, but it's not a threat. In fact. . . {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/are/is} pretty sure this is {PRONOUN/app1/poss} mentor's scent. And {PRONOUN/app1/poss} mentor has been hinting there'll be a test soon.

fail_text.unscathed_common: It turns out they were app1's own pawprints... app1 huffs with embarrassment, suddenly grateful {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/are/is} alone. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/don't/doesn't} want to look dumb in front of other cats.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: Boldy, s_c follows the scent to a trespassing rogue, and confronts them. Fur puffed but ears pricked forward curiously, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/ask/asks} what the rogue is doing in c_n territory. It seems to embarrass the other cat, who walks off huffily back over the border.
fail_text.death: Nose to the ground following the trail, app1 doesn't see the blow that kills {PRONOUN/app1/object}.
fail_text.injury: Nose to the ground following the trail, app1 doesn't see the blow coming. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/haul/hauls} {PRONOUN/app1/self} to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} feet, squealing with pain, and run for home.
